surah_info.description:
Name
The Surah derives its name from the initial letter Qaf, thereby implying that it is the Surah which opens with the alphabetic letter Qaf.
Period of Revelation
There is no authentic tradition to show as to when exactly this Surah was sent down. A study of the subject matter, however, reveals that its period of revelation is the second stage of the Holy Prophet's life at Makkah, which lasted from the third year of the Prophethood till the fifth year. We have given the characteristics of this period in the Introduction to the Surah Al-An'am. In view of those characteristics it can be said that this Surah might have been sent down in about the 5th year, when the antagonism of the disbelievers had become quite intense but had not yet assumed tyrannical proportions.
Theme and Topics
Authentic traditions show that the Holy Prophet used to recite this Surah generally in the Prayer on the Eid days. A woman named Umm Hisham bin Harithah, who was a neighbor of the Holy Prophet, says that she was able to commit Surah Qaf to memory only because she often heard it from the Holy Prophet in the Friday sermons. According to some other traditions he often recited it in the Fajr Prayer. This makes it abundantly clear that this was an important Surah in the sight of the Holy Prophet. That is why he made sure that its contents reached as many people as possible over and over again.
This reason for this importance can be easily understood by a careful study of the Surah. The theme of the entire Surah is the Hereafter. When the Holy Prophet started preaching his message in Makkah what surprised the people most was the news that people would be resurrected after death, and they would have to render an account of their deeds. They said that that was impossible; human mind could not believe that that would happen. After all, how could it be possible that when the body had disintegrated into dust the scattered particles would be reassembled after hundreds of thousands of years to make up the same body once again and raised up as a living body, Allah in response sent down this discourse. In it, on the one hand, arguments have been given for the possibility and occurrence of the Hereafter in a brief way, in short sentences, and, on the other, the people have been warned, as if to say: "Whether you express wonder and surprise, or you regard it as something remote
from reason, or deny it altogether, in any case it cannot change the truth. The absolute, un-alterable truth is that Allah knows the whereabouts of each and every particle of your body that has scattered away in the earth, and knows where and in what state it is. Allah's one signal is enough to make all the scattered particles gather together again and to make you rise up once again as you had been made in the first instance. Likewise, your this idea that you have been created and left free to yourselves in the world and that you have not been made answerable to anyone, is no more than a misunderstanding. The fact is that not only is Allah Himself directly aware of each act and word of yours, even of the ideas that pass in your mind, but His angels also are attached to each one of you, who are preserving the record of whatever you do and utter. When the time comes, you will come out of your graves at one call just as young shoots of vegetable sprout up from the earth on the first
shower of the rain. Then this heedlessness which obstructs your vision will be removed and you will see with your own eyes all that you are denying today. At that time you will realize that you had not been created to be irresponsible in this world but accountable to all your deeds the meeting out of the rewards and punishments, the Hell and Heaven, which you regard as impossible and imaginary things, will at that time become visible realities for you in consequence of your enmity and opposition to the Truth you will be cast into the same Hell which you regard as remote from reason today and the ones who fear the Merciful God and return to the path of righteousness, will be admitted to the same Paradise at whose mention you now express wonder and surprise.

surah_verses.arabic_text: قٓ ۚ وَٱلْقُرْءَانِ ٱلْمَجِيدِ
surah_verses.en_text: Qãf. By the glorious Quran!

surah_verses.arabic_text: بَلْ عَجِبُوٓا۟ أَن جَآءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ فَقَالَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ هَـٰذَا شَىْءٌ عَجِيبٌ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹All will be resurrected,˺ yet the deniers are astonished that a warner has come to them from among themselves ˹warning of resurrection˺. So the disbelievers say, “This is an astonishing thing!

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ۖ ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌۢ بَعِيدٌ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹Will we be returned to life,˺ when we are dead and reduced to dust? Such a return is impossible.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: قَدْ عَلِمْنَا مَا تَنقُصُ ٱلْأَرْضُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَعِندَنَا كِتَـٰبٌ حَفِيظٌۢ
surah_verses.en_text: We certainly know what the earth consumes of them ˹after their death˺, and with us is a well-preserved Record.<sup foot_note=77400>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِٱلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِىٓ أَمْرٍ مَّرِيجٍ
surah_verses.en_text: In fact, they reject the truth when it has come to them, so they are in a confused state.<sup foot_note=77401>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَفَلَمْ يَنظُرُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَوْقَهُمْ كَيْفَ بَنَيْنَـٰهَا وَزَيَّنَّـٰهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِن فُرُوجٍ
surah_verses.en_text: Have they not then looked at the sky above them: how We built it and adorned it ˹with stars˺, leaving it flawless?

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱلْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَـٰهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۭ بَهِيجٍ
surah_verses.en_text: As for the earth, We spread it out and placed upon it firm mountains, and produced in it every type of pleasant plant—

surah_verses.arabic_text: تَبْصِرَةً وَذِكْرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبْدٍ مُّنِيبٍ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹all as˺ an insight and a reminder to every servant who turns ˹to Allah˺.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً مُّبَـٰرَكًا فَأَنۢبَتْنَا بِهِۦ جَنَّـٰتٍ وَحَبَّ ٱلْحَصِيدِ
surah_verses.en_text: And We send down blessed rain from the sky, bringing forth gardens and grains for harvest,

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱلنَّخْلَ بَاسِقَـٰتٍ لَّهَا طَلْعٌ نَّضِيدٌ
surah_verses.en_text: and towering palm trees ˹loaded˺ with clustered fruit,

surah_verses.arabic_text: رِّزْقًا لِّلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِۦ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْخُرُوجُ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹as˺ a provision for ˹Our˺ servants. And with this ˹rain˺ We revive a lifeless land. Similar is the emergence ˹from the graves˺.

surah_verses.arabic_text: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَأَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ
surah_verses.en_text: Before them, the people of Noah denied ˹the truth,˺ as did the people of the Water-pit,<sup foot_note=77402>1</sup> Thamûd,

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ وَإِخْوَٰنُ لُوطٍ
surah_verses.en_text: ’Ȃd, Pharaoh, the kinfolk of Lot,

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَأَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ
surah_verses.en_text: the residents of the Forest,<sup foot_note=77403>1</sup> and the people of Tubba’.<sup foot_note=77404>2</sup> Each rejected ˹their˺ messenger, so My warning was fulfilled.

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَفَعَيِينَا بِٱلْخَلْقِ ٱلْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِى لَبْسٍ مِّنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ
surah_verses.en_text: Were We incapable of creating ˹them˺ the first time? In fact, they are in doubt about ˹their˺ re-creation.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِۦ نَفْسُهُۥ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ ٱلْوَرِيدِ
surah_verses.en_text: Indeed, ˹it is˺ We ˹Who˺ created humankind and ˹fully˺ know what their souls whisper to them, and We are closer to them than ˹their˺ jugular vein.

surah_verses.arabic_text: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى ٱلْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ
surah_verses.en_text: As the two recording-angels—˹one˺ sitting to the right, and ˹the other to˺ the left—note ˹everything˺,

surah_verses.arabic_text: مَّا يَلْفِظُ مِن قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ
surah_verses.en_text: not a word does a person utter without having a ˹vigilant˺ observer ready ˹to write it down˺.<sup foot_note=77405>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَجَآءَتْ سَكْرَةُ ٱلْمَوْتِ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹Ultimately,˺ with the throes of death will come the truth.<sup foot_note=77406>1</sup> This is what you were trying to escape!

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْوَعِيدِ
surah_verses.en_text: And the Trumpet will be blown.<sup foot_note=77407>1</sup> This is the Day ˹you were˺ warned of.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَجَآءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّعَهَا سَآئِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ
surah_verses.en_text: Each soul will come forth with an angel to drive it and another to testify.

surah_verses.arabic_text: لَّقَدْ كُنتَ فِى غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنكَ غِطَآءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹It will be said to the denier,˺ “You were totally heedless of this. Now We have lifted this veil of yours, so Today your sight is sharp!”

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ هَـٰذَا مَا لَدَىَّ عَتِيدٌ
surah_verses.en_text: And one’s accompanying-angel will say, “Here is the record ready with me.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَلْقِيَا فِى جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹It will be said to both angels,˺ “Throw into Hell every stubborn disbeliever,

surah_verses.arabic_text: مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ مُّرِيبٍ
surah_verses.en_text: withholder of good, transgressor, and doubter,

surah_verses.arabic_text: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلشَّدِيدِ
surah_verses.en_text: who set up another god with Allah. So cast them into the severe punishment.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: ۞ قَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ رَبَّنَا مَآ أَطْغَيْتُهُۥ وَلَـٰكِن كَانَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۭ بَعِيدٍ
surah_verses.en_text: One’s ˹devilish˺ associate will say, “Our Lord! I did not make them transgress. Rather, they were far astray ˹on their own˺.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا۟ لَدَىَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُم بِٱلْوَعِيدِ
surah_verses.en_text: Allah will respond, “Do not dispute in My presence, since I had already given you a warning.

surah_verses.arabic_text: مَا يُبَدَّلُ ٱلْقَوْلُ لَدَىَّ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِظَلَّـٰمٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
surah_verses.en_text: My Word cannot be changed,<sup foot_note=77408>1</sup> nor am I unjust to ˹My˺ creation.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ ٱمْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِن مَّزِيدٍ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹Beware of˺ the Day We will ask Hell, “Are you full ˹yet˺?” And it will respond, “Are there any more?”

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَأُزْلِفَتِ ٱلْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ
surah_verses.en_text: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far off.

surah_verses.arabic_text: هَـٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹And it will be said to them,˺ “This is what you were promised, for whoever ˹constantly˺ turned ˹to Allah˺ and kept up ˹His commandments˺—

surah_verses.arabic_text: مَّنْ خَشِىَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنَ بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَجَآءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُّنِيبٍ
surah_verses.en_text: who were in awe of the Most Compassionate without seeing ˹Him˺,<sup foot_note=77409>1</sup> and have come with a heart turning ˹only to Him˺.

surah_verses.arabic_text: ٱدْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَـٰمٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْخُلُودِ
surah_verses.en_text: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of eternal life!”

surah_verses.arabic_text: لَهُم مَّا يَشَآءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ
surah_verses.en_text: There they will have whatever they desire, and with Us is ˹even˺ more.<sup foot_note=77410>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا۟ فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ هَلْ مِن مَّحِيصٍ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We destroyed before them, who were far mightier than them. Then ˹when the torment came,˺ they ˹desperately˺ sought refuge in the land. ˹But˺ was there any escape?

surah_verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُۥ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى ٱلسَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ
surah_verses.en_text: Surely in this is a reminder for whoever has a ˹mindful˺ heart and lends an attentive ear.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبٍ
surah_verses.en_text: Indeed, We created the heavens and the earth and everything in between in six Days,<sup foot_note=77411>1</sup> and We were not ˹even˺ touched with fatigue.<sup foot_note=77412>2</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: فَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ ٱلْغُرُوبِ
surah_verses.en_text: So be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say. And glorify the praises of your Lord before sunrise and before sunset.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَأَدْبَـٰرَ ٱلسُّجُودِ
surah_verses.en_text: And glorify Him during part of the night<sup foot_note=77413>1</sup> and after the prayers.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ ٱلْمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ
surah_verses.en_text: And listen! On the Day the caller will call out from a near place,

surah_verses.arabic_text: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ ٱلصَّيْحَةَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْخُرُوجِ
surah_verses.en_text: the Day all will hear the ˹mighty˺ Blast in ˹all˺ truth,<sup foot_note=77414>1</sup> that will be the Day of emergence ˹from the graves˺.

surah_verses.arabic_text: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْىِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا ٱلْمَصِيرُ
surah_verses.en_text: It is certainly We Who give life and cause death. And to Us is the final return.

surah_verses.arabic_text: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹Beware of˺ the Day the earth will split open, letting them rush forth. That will be an easy gathering for Us.

surah_verses.arabic_text: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ عَلَيْهِم بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِٱلْقُرْءَانِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ
surah_verses.en_text: We know best what they say. And you ˹O Prophet˺ are not ˹there˺ to compel them ˹to believe˺. So remind with the Quran ˹only˺ those who fear My warning.
